#Text=3 .
#Text=Tailoring
#Text=Immunotherapy in Real-Life Clinical Practice
#Text=After the histology-agnostic approval of pembrolizumab in mismatch repair ( MMR)-deficient tumors , the predictive molecular pathology scenario in cancer immunotherapy changed radically .

#Text=For the first time in the history of medicine , a drug ( in this case , an immune-checkpoint inhibitor ) was approved based on a specific molecular feature of the neoplasm , irrespective of its anatomical site of origin .

#Text=A multitude of different tools has been proposed to inform immunotherapy , including morphology , immunohistochemistry ( IHC ) , polymerase chain reaction ( PCR)-based techniques and next-generation technology assays , such as next-generation sequencing ( NGS ) or multiplex barcode technology ( e. g. , NanoString ) .
#Text=However , not all the available tools are validated for patients ’ selection in clinical practice , as shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=.
#Text=Among new biomarkers to select patients for immunotherapy , the tumor mutational burden ( TMB ) has been shown a strong correlation with the response to some compounds .
#Text=TMB is defined by the total number of somatic nonsynonymous mutations per coding area of the tumor DNA .
#Text=It has been hypothesized that tumors with a higher TMB are more likely to express neoantigens and to induce a more robust immune response in the presence of immune checkpoint inhibitors .
#Text=Regrettably , the TMB analysis is considered expensive , time-consuming , and deceptive if the analyses are carried out with an unsuitable NGS panel .
#Text=Another important facet in TMB analysis is represented by the lack of widely adopted guidelines and recommendations for its assessment and reporting .
#Text=Initially , TMB was determined using wide approaches ( e. g. , whole exome sequencing ) , but more focused gene panels are currently being explored .

#Text=In addition , there are several indications that TMB is not a universal biomarker , as its value varies not only across tumor types but also across different genomic regions and during the time .
#Text=This notion highlights the need for disease-specific TMB panels and thresholds .
#Text=Likewise , the analysis of the MMR status is troubled by the vastity of the existing diagnostic methods in the substantial absence of companion diagnostic ( CD ) tests .
#Text=In general , MMR IHC is mirrored by microsatellite instability ( MSI ) in endometrial and colorectal cancers .
#Text=However , not all MMR-deficient tumors show MSI ( e. g. , breast cancers ) , questioning the interchangeability of these analyses as pan-cancer predictive tests .
#Text=Hence , MMR/MSI assays have been originally developed by geneticists to identify Lynch syndrome families and not for choosing the optimal drug to treat acquired tumors .
#Text=Given the wide heterogeneity in the repertoire of molecular alterations in immune-related genes across different tumor types (
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=) , novel , efficient , reproducible , and reliable techniques coupled with tumor-specific methods and guidelines are needed .
#Text=Another important issue related to the patient ’s selection for immunotherapy is represented by the PD-L1 analysis by IHC .

#Text=In this respect , important harmonization efforts have been made to standardize both the preanalytical and interpretative phases of PD-L1 testing , at least in non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) .

#Text=The reproducibility of PD-L1 testing in real-life clinical practice evaluated both for “ closed ” and “ open ” platforms , showed overlapping results , particularly when the 22C3 antibody clone was used .
#Text=On the other hand , there are several clues to advise that the same interpretation guidelines should not be translated across different tumor types .
#Text=For example , the tumor proportion score ( TPS ) works perfectly for lung cancer but not for head and neck cancer , where the combined positive score ( CPS ) is more reliable .

#Text=These two scoring systems are rather different , given that the former considers only the percentage of PD-L1-positive neoplastic cells , while the latter combines all PD-L1-positive cells ( i. e. , tumor cells , lymphocytes , and macrophages ) into the following formula .
#Text=Although the CPS can theoretically exceed the value of 100 , the maximum score is defined as 100 .
#Text=Fascinating perspectives are being provided by experimental models addressing the plasticity of the cellular inflammatory response of the host .
#Text=There are several lines of evidence to suggest that the myeloid-derived cell function is a finely tuned mechanism to control tumor growth .
#Text=Specifically , both in local and hematopoietic niches , its crosstalk with the tumor cells as well as with exogenous stimuli , is based on the microbiota repertoire .
